queries.original_query: What is the FY2019 cash conversion cycle (CCC) for General Mills? CCC is defined as: DIO + DSO - DPO. DIO is defined as: 365 * (average inventory between FY2018 and FY2019) / (FY2019 COGS). DSO is defined as: 365 * (average accounts receivable between FY2018 and FY2019) / (FY2019 Revenue). DPO is defined as: 365 * (average accounts payable between FY2018 and FY2019) / (FY2019 COGS + change in inventory between FY2018 and FY2019). Round your answer to two decimal places. Address the question by using the line items and information shown within the income statement and the balance sheet.
queries.expanded_query: What is the **cash conversion cycle (CCC)** for **General Mills** in **FY2019** as reported in the **annual report**? The **CCC** is calculated using the formula: **Days Inventory Outstanding (DIO) + Days Sales Outstanding (DSO) - Days Payable Outstanding (DPO)**. Specifically, **DIO** is determined by the formula: **365 * (average inventory from FY2018 to FY2019) / (FY2019 Cost of Goods Sold (COGS))**. **DSO** is calculated as: **365 * (average accounts receivable from FY2018 to FY2019) / (FY2019 Revenue)**. Lastly, **DPO** is computed using: **365 * (average accounts payable from FY2018 to FY2019) / (FY2019 COGS + change in inventory from FY2018 to FY2019)**. Please ensure to round your final CCC answer to two decimal places, utilizing the relevant line items from the **income statement** and **balance sheet**.

queries.original_query: What is FY2018 days payable outstanding (DPO) for Walmart? DPO is defined as: 365 * (average accounts payable between FY2017 and FY2018) / (FY2018 COGS + change in inventory between FY2017 and FY2018). Round your answer to two decimal places. Please base your judgments on the information provided primarily in the statement of financial position and the P&L statement.
queries.expanded_query: What is the **Days Payable Outstanding (DPO)** for **Walmart** in **Fiscal Year 2018 (FY2018)**? DPO is calculated using the formula: **365 * (Average Accounts Payable from FY2017 to FY2018) / (FY2018 Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) + Change in Inventory from FY2017 to FY2018)**. Please round your answer to two decimal places. Ensure your calculations are based on data found in the **Annual Report**, specifically the **Statement of Financial Position** and the **Profit and Loss (P&L) Statement**.

queries.original_query: Based on the information provided primarily in the statement of income, what is the FY2018 - FY2019 change in unadjusted operating income % margin for Walmart? Answer in units of percents and round to one decimal place.

queries.original_query: What is the FY2018 - FY2020 3 year average unadjusted EBITDA % margin for Walmart? Define unadjusted EBITDA as unadjusted operating income + depreciation and amortization from the cash flow statement. Answer in units of percents and round to one decimal place.
